content: The way to manage this isn’t through a diet and exercise program — you can’t solve this with a temporary solution and like you have already noticed — as soon as you stop following your temporary solution, the weight comes back. There are programs out there for people who want to make these small changes — they are not found under diet or exercise sections though. They’re found under success and self-discipline. You have to permanently make changes to your lifestyle — I’m the same size as I was in college. I’ve had a baby, and I’ve had stress and other factors over my life where I gained weight — but because of the habits I’ve maintained throughout my life like: exercise everyday — even if it’s only 20 minutes, even if I’m feeling a little under the weather and can only manage a short walk around the block, skip bacon and processed foods, don’t eat dessert every day, make sure I get a good breakfast and fill my plates with more veggies than fruit or meat, etc. I live a healthy, active lifestyle and it’s not easy but these are habits I’ve decided to keep forever and that’s the mindset necessary to maintain your health throughout life. It’s always funny to me how people realize they have to shower every day and brush their teeth every day if they don’t want to smell bad or have rotten teeth, but when it comes to food and exercise — they have no trouble skipping days of being healthy and then act like going on a diet once a year is going to somehow prevent health problems in the future. I’m pretty sure I couldn’t expect a good set of teeth if I only brushed for 3 months out of the year.
